Package com.heslington_hustle.screens

Class ErrorScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
      • com.heslington_hustle.screens.ErrorScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    public class ErrorScreen
extends com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
    This class represents an error screen displayed when the player encounters certain errors during gameplay, such as running out of time or energy.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ErrorScreen​(HeslingtonHustle game, java.lang.String errorType)
      Constructs a new ErrorScreen with the specified game instance and error type.

      Renders the error screen by clearing the screen and drawing the stage.

      Called when the screen is resized.

      Called when this screen becomes the current screen for the Game.

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show()
        Called when this screen becomes the current screen for the Game. Sets up the UI elements for displaying the error message and a back button.
        Specified by:
        show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        show in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter

      • render

        public void render​(float delta)
        Renders the error screen by clearing the screen and drawing the stage.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        render in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
        Parameters:
        delta - the time in seconds since the last render

      • resize

        public void resize​(int width,
                   int height)
        Called when the screen is resized. Updates the stage's viewport accordingly.
        Specified by:
        resize in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        resize in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
        Parameters:
        width - the new width of the screen
        height - the new height of the screen

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes of resources used by the error screen, such as the stage and skin. This method is called when the screen is no longer needed.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        dispose in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Called when the screen is hidden. Sets the input processor to null.
        Specified by:
        hide in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        hide in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
